current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Designating the week of September 23
		  through September 29, 2013, as

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That the

designates the
			 week of September 23 through September 29, 2013, as

supports the
			 goals and ideals of National Estuaries Week;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
for estuaries, including the scientific study,
			 preservation, protection, and restoration of estuaries; and

text.#text:
reaffirms the
			 support of the

expresses the
			 intent of the Senate to continue working to understand, protect, and restore
			 the estuaries of the United States.

Whereas the estuary regions of the United States
			 constitute a significant share of the economy of the United States, with as
			 much as 41 percent of the gross domestic product of the United States generated
			 in coastal shoreline counties;

Whereas, in 2011, commercial fish landings generated
			 $5,300,000,000 and recreational anglers spent $26,780,000,000;

Whereas estuaries provide critical ecosystem services that
			 protect human health and public safety, including water filtration, flood
			 control, shoreline stabilization, erosion prevention, and the protection of
			 coastal communities during extreme weather events;

Whereas changes in sea level can affect estuarine water
			 quality and estuarine habitats;
Whereas the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
provides that it is the policy of the United States to preserve,
			 protect, develop, and, if possible, restore or enhance the resources of the
			 coastal zone of the United States, including estuaries, for current and future
			 generations;

text.#text:
Whereas scientific study leads to better understanding of
			 the benefits of estuaries to human and ecological communities;

Whereas estuary restoration efforts restore natural
			 infrastructure in local communities in a cost-effective manner, helping to
			 create jobs and reestablish the natural functions of estuaries that yield
			 countless benefits; and

quote.#tail:
to increase
			 awareness among all people of the United States, including Federal Government
			 and State and local government officials, about the importance of healthy
			 estuaries and the need to protect and restore estuaries: Now, therefore, be
			 it

text.#text:
Whereas the week of September 23 through September 29,
			 2013, has been recognized as

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 263 IS: Designating the week of September 23 through September 29, 2013, as “National Estuaries Week”.
